title: Oscars 2017: The Best Beauty Looks on the Red Carpet - Vogue
text: Oscars 2017: The 10 Best Beauty Looks on the Red Carpet February 27, 2017 2:08 AM 1 / 10 Ruth Negga Photo: Getty Images Tonight's Oscars 2017 red carpet confirmed that true glamour is best carried off with a wholly personalized custom spin. Ruth Negga, nominated for her role in Loving , channeled the proverbial Queen of Hearts, topping her trademark close-cropped coif with a ruby tiara that was perfectly calibrated to her burgundy lips and eyes. Emma Stone tucked soft, coppery waves behind one bedecked ear, eyes edged in gold, lips coated in crimson, channeling the sirens of Old Hollywood. Michelle Williamsâ€™ gamine peroxide pixie was further sweetened by long lashes and rosy cheeks, the behind-the-neck bow of her black haltered dress offering a bit of classic gamine contrast. The slick center part found fans in Jessica Biel and Naomie Harris, whose modern takes on glamour were red carpet standouts. And Best Actress nominee Isabelle Huppert elevated her aspirational brand of French insouciance with shimmering lids and a shoulder-spilling auburn mane offset by a gleaming silver ear cuff. Here, the tk# best beauty looks from the red carpet.
